Question: Java: How to get the value of a variable in a method:
I have a method that takes a variable as a parameter. I want to get the value of that variable in the method. How can I do that?
Please using this api: System.out.println.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.out.println
<<<code>>>: try { printWriter.write("1
"); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the following code to get the value of the variable: String s = ps.text();
